evidence_span: The effect of higher hydrogen contents was investigated on l-in. diameter tubes with a wall thickness of 0.060 in. The tubes were irradiated in DFR. The results, summarized in Fig. 9, show the variation in failure stress for tubes containing 0.5-in. slits. In the range $1 \times 1 0 ^ { 1 9 } \mathrm { n / c m ^ { 2 } }$ to $7 \times 1 0 ^ { 2 0 } \mathrm { n / c m ^ { 2 } }$ (Ni), no dose effect was observed on the relationship between failure stress and slit length.
